IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT FROM SHISD:

Panther Nation,
Spring Hill ISD is canceling all classes tomorrow, August 27, 2020, including virtual learners due to the pending storms from the hurricane. There is a likelihood that we will lose power from the high winds that are expected. With the new COVID-19 protocols in place, including social distancing, we are not willing to take the chance of no electricity and are erring on the side of precaution. We feel that this is the best decision for the safety of our students, faculty and staff. We will make an announcement tomorrow morning concerning after school athletic events. Classes will resume on Friday, August 28, 2020 at regular time.

Stay safe and hopefully we will be back together soon.

Texas Bank and Trust is pleased to announce the selection of nine seniors from Spring Hill High School to serve on its 2020-2021 Student Board of Directors.

The TB&T Student Board is a prestigious program recognizing outstanding high school seniors in the community. Students were selected based on their grade point average, extra-curricular activities, and after school work activities. Students had to submit an essay with their application as well as two letters of recommendation from either a faculty member or administrator to be considered for the program. The Student Board program is designed to introduce students to banking and money management at a critical point in their lives, and provide them with the essential economic building blocks to earning, spending, saving, and investing money.
CONGRATULATIONS!

Panther Nation,
Google Classroom can be opened on Xbox and Playstation. There isn’t an app that the students can add to their consoles. Instead, they are going to have to use the built-in browsers that come on the two devices. On Xbox, it is Microsoft Edge. On Playstation, it is the “www” browser. Your students will probably know how to find the browsers on their consoles, but if not, each one has a search function they can access on the home screen. On XBox, follow the following steps:

Go to Home menu --> My games and apps --> Scroll down to apps--> Go to the Edge application and open it

Once the browser has been opened:

Type in classroom.google.com in the URL bar.

A prompt for a Google account will appear.

Type in your school district email and password – it doesn’t end in google.com and that is ok!

The Classroom home screen will open up.

If students have a keyboard they can plug in, they will have a much easier time of navigation. Otherwise, they will have to use their controllers to click on the classroom tiles, open up assignments and type.

An amazing Valentine for an amazing young lady.

Spring Hill Parents,
FLU season has arrived!
Common signs and symptoms of the flu are fever greater than 100F, coughing/sneezing,
headache, body aches and extreme fatigue.
Please help us minimize the spread of the flu by keeping your student home if they have a fever
greater than 100F. Your student must also be fever free for a full 24 hours WITHOUT the use of
fever reducing medications like Tylenol or Ibuprofen before they can return to school.
Good handwashing, staying home when running fever and exhibiting flu symptoms and yearly
flu vaccines are the best way to protect your family and reduce the spread of the flu.
Thank you for helping us keep our Spring Hill students healthy!

Spring Hill High School Theatre Department presents Joseph Kesselring's infectiously funny dark comedy Arsenic and Old Lace. Murder, mayhem, and madcap lunacy abound in the Brewster home. Mortimer Brewster is a drama critic whose two spinster aunts have a unique hobby—they poison lonely old men with elderberry wine laced with arsenic. One of his brothers thinks he’s Teddy Roosevelt, and another murderous brother is on the run from the law. All are getting in the way of Mortimer’s plans to marry the woman he loves. Playwright Joseph Kesselring’s masterpiece became an instant classic when the film version was released in 1944 directed by Frank Capra and starring Cary Grant.

Performances Nov. 14-16 at 7 pm at the Spring Hill High School's Little Theatre

For more information or tickets please call 903-446-3336 or email contact Becky Smith at bsmith@shisd.net. Tickets will also be available online.

The Spring Hill High School Blue Brigade earned straight 1s for a First Division rating at the UIL Marching Contest. As one commentator stated, "they are the epitome of what a military marching band should be, both marching and playing."

What is more impressive than the first division rating that the Blue Brigade received today at marching contest? The way these young men and women handled the complete and utter uncertainty of the future of the Blue Brigade Band over the past five months. After watching the band perform I couldn't help but think about how uncertain everything about the Blue Brigade was this summer. This performance shows the true character of our students and the leadership within the Blue Brigade Band. Wayne Guidry, Superintendent

Our bell rings at 3:10 for classes to release and our lines start rolling by 3:15. Our lines are clear by 3:30!!! It is amazing that we have this process down to 15 MINUTES!!!! Thank you to our amazing staff and parents who keep the lines moving each day!
No need to wait for hours in this heat to pick your child up at the Primary campus. Please help us keep our roads clear for traffic.
Go Panthers!
